caption: Commending the Honorable Gibson D. (Gib) Lewis on his long and distinguished tenure as speaker of the Texas House of Representatives and extending sincere appreciation to him for his many years of outstanding service on behalf of the legislature and the citizens of Texas.
In memory of Matthew Alan Lewis.
Commending Tom Heffernan on the occasion of his selection as the outstanding agriculture science and technology teacher in Region II of the National Vocational Agriculture Teachers Association.
Congratulating Joe F. Collins on the occasion of his retirement.
Honoring and recognizing Ignacio Zaragoza and Rafaela Zaragoza for their contribution to history.
Relating to permitting a victim, close relative of a deceased victim, or guardian of a victim to make a statement before punishment of a criminal defendant is assessed.
In memory of Dr. Weimar F. Hein.
Relating to an exemption for certain religious, charitable, or educational organizations from local hotel occupancy taxes.
Relating to permitting a victim, close relative of a deceased victim, or guardian of a victim to make a statement before punishment of a criminal defendant is assessed.
Encouraging the attorney general of Texas to settle the case of LULAC v. Mattox by adopting a plan for the election of district judges.
In memory of Representative Larry Q. Evans.
Relating to the qualifications of a presiding judge of an administrative judicial region.
Relating to changes in the election processes and procedures.
Relating to eligibility and compensation of election judges and clerks, and activities of poll watchers.
Relating to the canvass of certain elections.
Relating to damages on dishonor of a check.
Relating to validation of the creation of the Medina County Underground Water Conservation District and actions of the district.
Relating to the creation, dissolution, powers and duties of underground water conservation districts and management and conservation of the Edwards Aquifer.
Relating to the composition of the juvenile board of Medina County.
In memory of Ruth Curry Lawler.
In memory of Alfredo Garza, Jr.
Congratulating Texas Lutheran College on its Centennial.
Honoring James Hill for his years of outstanding service as a teacher, principal, and superintendent and extending best wishes to him on the occasion of his retirement.
Commending Maurice J. Zerr on his outstanding public service as superintendent of the D'Hanis Independent School District.
Honoring Robert William Nations on his outstanding career in education.
Honoring Leon L. Stoeltje on the occasion of his retirement as chief appraiser for the Wilson County Appraisal District.
Honoring Naomi Ridge for her many years service as a teacher and librarian.
Congratulating the Lytle High School UIL contestants.
In memory of Chief Deputy Ken Norris Meister of the Zavala County Sheriff's Department.
Relating to the administration of, benefits payable by, and credit established in the Teacher Retirement System of Texas.
Relating to the admission of children to the public free schools.
Relating to candidacy for two or more offices to be voted on at one or more elections held on the same day.
Relating to certain payments of money to school districts.
Relating to the establishment and funding of a young farmer endowment program.
Relating to processes and procedures connected with the registration of voters; providing criminal penalties.
Relating to certain election processes and procedures.
Relating to the acquisition and maintenance of and computer access to certain public information maintained by the secretary of state.
Relating to certain absentee voting processes and procedures.
Relating to dates for conducting elections.
Condemning attacks by Iraq on Israel; expressing sympathy for the loss of life, casualties, and destruction; and commending the Government of Israel for their restraint.
In memory of Howard Edward Butt, Sr.
Relating to validation of the creation of the Medina County Underground Water Conservation District and actions of the district.
Endorsing the Bill of Responsibilities of the Freedoms Foundation at Valley Forge.
Designating the month of October, 1991, as "Cowboy Music Month" and honoring The Spirit of Texas cowboy band and Russell D. "Red" Steagall.
